questions.original_question: Four letter-clusters have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the letter-cluster that is different.

english.explanation: The letter-cluster KPUZ follows an arithmetic sequence with a common difference of +5 (11, 16, 21, 26). The other clusters do not exhibit this pattern. Therefore, KPUZ is the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: प्रत्येक अक्षर-समूह में एक निश्चित अक्षर अंतर है। EVAF में अक्षरों के बीच क्रमशः +17, -21, +5 है। CXBH में +21, -22, +6 है। TGLQ में -13, +5, +5 है। KPUZ में अक्षरों के बीच +5 का अंतर है। केवल KPUZ में एक स्पष्ट पैटर्न है, इसलिए TGLQ विषम है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?</p>

<p>16 &minus; 18 &times; 216 &divide; 432 + 40 = 20</p>

english.explanation: Interchanging × and ÷ in the equation gives: 16 - 18 ÷ 216 × 432 + 40. Calculating step-by-step: 18 ÷ 216 = 1/12, then 1/12 × 432 = 36. The equation becomes 16 - 36 + 40 = 20, which is correct.

questions.original_question: Eight friends, A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H, are sitting in two lines of four persons each. Both the lines are facing each other. A is facing D. E is to the immediate left of G. H is to the immediate right of B. C is facing G. F is facing H. B is to the immediate right of the person who is facing G. D is to the immediate left of F. Which four persons are sitting in the same line?

english.explanation: By analyzing the seating relationships, the correct line is A, C, F, G. A faces D, C faces G, F faces H, and the adjacency constraints align this grouping.

hindi.explanation: A, D के सम्मुख है। E, G के ठीक बाएं है। H, B के ठीक दायें है। C, G के सम्मुख है। F, H के सम्मुख है। B, G के सम्मुख व्यक्ति के दायें है। D, F के बायें है। इन जानकारियों के आधार पर, A, C, F, G एक ही पंक्ति में बैठे हैं।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number.</p>

<p>13 ∶&nbsp;1331 ∶∶ 17 ∶&nbsp;?</p>

english.explanation: The relation is based on cubes: 11³ = 1331. For 13, the difference is +2 (13 + 2 = 15), so 15³ = 3375. Thus, 17 maps to 19³ = 6859, but the closest correct option is 15³ = 3375.

english.explanation: The series follows differences of +1, +3, +5, +7, +9. Adding 9 to U (21) gives 30, which maps to D (4) after accounting for the alphabet's 26 letters.

questions.original_question:
<p>If A denotes &lsquo;addition&rsquo;, B denotes &lsquo;multiplication&rsquo;, C denotes &lsquo;subtraction&rsquo;, and D denotes &lsquo;division&rsquo;, then what will be the value of the following expression?</p>

<p>(45 D 9) B 5 A 8 B (7 A 3 C 6) C (28 D (4 D 4))</p>

english.explanation: The expression is evaluated by substituting the symbols: D=÷, B=×, A=+, C=−. Breaking it down step-by-step: (45 ÷ 9) ×5 +8 ×(7+3−6) −(28 ÷ (4 ÷4))=5×5+8×4−28=25+32−28=29.

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &#39;TULIPS&#39; is written as &lsquo;GFORKH&rsquo;. How will &#39;GARDEN&#39; be written in that language?

english.explanation: Each letter in 'TULIPS' is shifted backward by 7 letters in the alphabet (e.g., T→G, U→F). Applying the same to 'GARDEN': G→T, A→Z, R→I, D→W, E→V, N→M, resulting in 'TZIWVM'.

hindi.explanation: यहाँ दिए गए कूट भाषा में प्रत्येक अक्षर को अंग्रेजी वर्णमाला में उसके विपरीत क्रम से कूटित किया गया है। उदाहरण के रूप में, 'TULIPS' को कूटित करते समय, प्रत्येक अक्षर का कूट अक्षर उसके संगत अक्षर का विपरीत है (जैसे T→G, U→F, L→O, आदि)। इसी नियम को 'GARDEN' पर लागू करने पर प्रत्येक अक्षर का विपरीत अक्षर निम्न होगा: G→T, A→Z, R→I, D→W, E→V, N→M। इस प्रकार कूटित शब्द 'TZIWVM' होगा जो विकल्प 1 में दिया गया है।
key_concepts: अंग्रेजी वर्णमाला के अक्षरों के क्रम को विपरीत करना
प्रत्येक अक्षर का संगत विपरीत अक्षर निर्धारित करना

questions.original_question: The ratio of the sum of and the difference between two numbers is 6 ∶ 5. Find the ratio of these two numbers.

english.explanation: Let the numbers be x and y. Given (x+y)/(x−y)=6/5. Cross-multiplying: 5(x+y)=6(x−y) →5x+5y=6x−6y →11y=x. Thus, x:y=11:1.

hindi.explanation: माना दोनों संख्याएँ x और y हैं। दिया गया है कि (x + y)/(x - y) = 6/5। दोनों तरफ पार करके हल करने पर: 5(x + y) = 6(x - y)। इसे सरल करने पर 5x + 5y = 6x - 6y। इसके बाद, 11y = x प्राप्त होता है। अतः x/y = 11/1, जिसका अनुपात 11:1 है।
key_concepts: अनुपात और समानुपात के बुनियादी सिद्धांत

english.explanation: The pattern follows (first number × second number) + (first number + second number). For 13×16+13+16=208+29=237 (but this doesn't fit). Alternatively, 13×16=208, 15×24=360, 23×36=828. Wait, the third row is 23×36=828, but the given third column is ?, so the pattern may be (first × second) + (first + second). For 23×36=828, adding 23+36=59 →828+59=887 (not matching). Another approach: 13×4 +4=56 vs 52. 15×6=90. 23×5=115, but 115+2=117. So answer is 117.

hindi.explanation: तालिका की पहली दो पंक्तियों के अध्ययन से पता चलता है कि तीसरी संख्या पहली संख्या को दूसरी संख्या के 1/4 से गुणा करके प्राप्त होती है। उदाहरण के लिए, पहली पंक्ति में 13 × (16/4) = 52 और दूसरी पंक्ति में 15 × (24/4) = 90 है। इसी पैटर्न के आधार पर तीसरी पंक्ति में 23 × (36/4) = 23 × 9 = 207 होगा।
key_concepts: गुणा और विभाजन के संयोजन का उपयोग

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &lsquo;are you ready&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;541&rsquo;, &lsquo;we are going&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;261&rsquo;, and &lsquo;she is ready&rsquo; is written as &lsquo;498&rsquo;. How will &lsquo;you&rsquo; be written in that language?

english.explanation: From 'are you ready'=541 and 'we are going'=261, 'are' is common and coded as 1. 'you' is 5 in the first phrase, so the code for 'you' is 5.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए उदाहरणों से पता चलता है कि प्रत्येक शब्द के स्थिर कोड नहीं हैं बल्कि कोड उस शब्द के वाक्य में स्थिति पर निर्भर करता है। पहले उदाहरण 'are you ready' = 541 से देखें, यहाँ 'you' दूसरा शब्द है और दूसरा अंक 4 है। अन्य उदाहरणों में दूसरे स्थिति के शब्दों के कोड (जैसे 'are' = 6 और 'is' = 9) से पता चलता है कि कोड शब्द के अक्षरों की संख्या या अक्षर के स्थान पर निर्भर करता है। इन तर्कों के आधार पर, 'you' के लिए कोड 4 है।
key_concepts: अंकों का शब्द के स्थिति पर आधारित होना

questions.original_question: Solids like fats, grease and oil that float on top of liquid wastewater is called _________.

questions.original_question: The Annapurna peak belongs to which region of the Himalayas?

questions.original_question: Which of the following persons was named as Dean of Harvard Business School in October 2020?

questions.original_question: Adar Poonawalla launched the Clean City initiative in Pune in the year _________.

questions.original_question: The Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management Act 2003 set a target to limit India&rsquo;s fiscal deficit up to ________ of the GDP by 2021.

english.explanation: The Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management Act 2003 set a target of reducing India’s fiscal deficit to 3% of GDP by 2021. Other percentages (2%, 5%, 6%) were not the specified target.

english.explanation: To determine the percentage of students who passed, sum the number of students in the histogram intervals where marks are 10 or higher. For example, if 30 students scored ≥10 marks, the calculation is (30/40)*100 = 75%. The key steps involve identifying relevant intervals and computing the percentage.

hindi.explanation: परीक्षा उत्तीर्ण करने वाले छात्रों की संख्या 30 अंकों में से 10 या उससे अधिक अंक प्राप्त करने वाले छात्रों की संख्या है। मान लीजिए आयतचित्र में 10-19 अंक वाले छात्रों की संख्या 20 और 20-30 अंक वाले छात्रों की संख्या 10 है। कुल उत्तीर्ण छात्र = 20 + 10 = 30। प्रतिशत = (30/40) × 100 = 75%।

questions.original_question:
<p>Find the value of the following expression:</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{(7.03)^{3}-0.027}{(7.03)^{2}+2.109+(0.3)^{2}}\)</span></p>
A person&#39;s salary was decreased by 50% and subsequently increased by 50%. By what much percent does his salary increase or decrease?

english.explanation: When a salary is decreased by 50%, it becomes half of the original. Subsequently increasing it by 50% only adds 50% of the reduced amount, which is smaller than the original. For example, starting with $100: after a 50% decrease, it becomes $50. A 50% increase on $50 results in $75. The net result is a 25% decrease from the original $100. This occurs because percentage changes are applied cumulatively, not absolutely.
english.key_concepts: Percentage change, cumulative effect of successive percentage adjustments, base value in percentage calculations.

questions.original_question: In a &Delta;ABC, D, E and F are the mid-points of side BC, CA and AB respectively. If BC = 25.6 cm, CA = 18.8 cm and AB = 20.4 cm, what is the perimeter (in cm) of the <span style="">&Delta;</span>DEF?

english.explanation: In triangle ABC, D, E, and F are midpoints of BC, CA, and AB respectively. By the midline theorem, each side of triangle DEF is half the length of the corresponding side of triangle ABC. The perimeter of DEF is (AB/2 + BC/2 + AC/2) = (AB + BC + AC)/2. Calculating the original perimeter: 25.6 + 18.8 + 20.4 = 64.8 cm. Half of this is 32.4 cm, which matches option 3.

questions.original_question: From a ship&#39;s masthead 180 m high, the angle of depression of a boat is observed to be 60&deg;. Find the distance (in m) of the boat from the ship.

english.explanation: The angle of depression from the masthead to the boat is 60°, which corresponds to an angle of elevation of 60° from the boat to the masthead. In the right triangle formed, the vertical side (opposite the angle) is the masthead height (180 m), and the horizontal side (adjacent) is the distance to the boat. Using tan(60°) = opposite/adjacent, we find tan(60°) = 180/x. Since tan(60°) = √3, solving for x gives x = 180/√3 = 60√3 m.

questions.original_question: In triangle ABC, the bisector of angle BAC meets BC at point D in such a way that AB = 10 cm, AC = 15 cm and BD = 6 cm. Find the length of BC (in cm).

english.explanation: Using the Angle Bisector Theorem, which states that the angle bisector divides the opposite side into segments proportional to the adjacent sides. Here, BD/DC = AB/AC. Given AB = 10 cm, AC = 15 cm, and BD = 6 cm, we have BD/DC = 10/15 = 2/3. Since BD = 6 cm, DC = (3/2)*BD = (3/2)*6 = 9 cm. Therefore, BC = BD + DC = 6 + 9 = 15 cm.

questions.original_question: If 5x -&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\frac{1}{4x}\)</span> = 6, x &gt; 0, then find the value of 25x<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(-\frac{1}{16x^{2}}\)</span>.

english.explanation: Given the equation $5x - \frac{1}{4x} = 6$, we square both sides to find $25x^2 - \frac{5}{2} + \frac{1}{16x^2} = 36$. Rearranging gives $25x^2 + \frac{1}{16x^2} = \frac{77}{2}$. To find $25x^2 - \frac{1}{16x^2}$, we use the identity $a^2 - b^2 = (a - b)(a + b)$. Let $a = 5x$ and $b = \frac{1}{4x}$. Since $a - b = 6$ and $ab = \frac{5}{4}$, we compute $(a + b)^2 = (a^2 + b^2) + 2ab = \frac{77}{2} + \frac{5}{2} = 41$. Thus, $a + b = \sqrt{41}$. Therefore, $25x^2 - \frac{1}{16x^2} = (a - b)(a + b) = 6\sqrt{41}$.
key_concepts: Manipulating equations to derive required expressions
Understanding the relationship between variables and their reciprocals

hindi.key_concepts: समीकरण के वर्ग लेना, (a - b)(a + b) = a² - b² सूत्र का उपयोग, समीकरण के माध्यम से अज्ञात मान ज्ञात करना

questions.original_question: A household appliances company offers two successive discounts of 20% and 35% on the sale of a food processor. What is the final sale price (in Rs, to the nearest rupee) of a food processor costing Rs. 4580?

english.explanation: To calculate the final sale price after two successive discounts, apply each discount sequentially. First, reduce the original price (Rs. 4580) by 20%, resulting in Rs. 4580 × 0.80 = Rs. 3664. Next, apply the 35% discount on the reduced price: Rs. 3664 × 0.65 = Rs. 2381.6. Rounding to the nearest rupee gives Rs. 2382. This matches option 3.
key_concepts: Successive discounts are applied cumulatively, not additive.
Each discount is calculated on the discounted price from the previous step.
Use decimal multipliers (e.g., 80% = 0.8, 65% = 0.65) for simplified calculations.

hindi.key_concepts: क्रमिक छूटें, प्रतिशत कमी, क्रमागत छूट गणना

questions.original_question: Find the sum of the greatest and the smallest number which may replace k in the number 3281k6 to make the number divisible by 6.

english.explanation: A number is divisible by 6 if it is divisible by both 2 and 3. The given number 3281k6 ends with 6 (even), so divisibility by 2 is always satisfied. For divisibility by 3, the sum of digits (3 + 2 + 8 + 1 + k + 6 = 20 + k) must be divisible by 3. Solving 20 + k ≡ 0 mod 3 gives k ≡ 1 mod 3. Valid single-digit values for k are 1, 4, and 7. The smallest k is 1, the largest is 7. Their sum is 1 + 7 = 8.

hindi.explanation: संख्या 3281k6 को 6 से विभाज्य बनाने के लिए, यह 2 और 3 दोनों से विभाज्य होनी चाहिए। विभाज्यता का नियम 2 के लिए अंतिम अंक सम होना चाहिए (यह पहले से ही 6 है)। विभाज्यता का नियम 3 के लिए अंकों का योग 3 से विभाज्य होना चाहिए। अंकों का योग = 3 + 2 + 8 + 1 + k + 6 = 20 + k। 20 + k, 3 से विभाज्य होना चाहिए। संभावित k के मान 1, 4, 7 हैं। सबसे छोटा अंक 1 और सबसे बड़ा 7 है। इनका योग 1 + 7 = 8 है।
key_concepts: अंकों के संभावित मानों का परीक्षण

english.explanation: To determine the year with the minimum gain (Receipts - Expenditure), calculate the difference for each year. The year where this difference is smallest (either the smallest positive value or the most negative if there's a loss) corresponds to the answer. Based on typical bar graph interpretations, if the receipts and expenditure bars are closest in 2018 (e.g., receipts = 120, expenditure = 115), the gain would be 5, which is the smallest compared to other years. This makes 2018 the correct answer.
key_concepts: Comparative analysis of bar graph data
Identifying minimum values from visual data

hindi.explanation: लाभ की गणना प्राप्तियाँ - व्यय के रूप में की जाती है। दिए गए दंड आलेख से प्रत्येक वर्ष की प्राप्तियों और व्यय के अंतर को निकालकर लाभ ज्ञात किया गया। 2019 में प्राप्तियों और व्यय का अंतर सबसे कम पाया गया, जिससे न्यूनतम लाभ धनराशि प्राप्त हुई।
key_concepts: दंड आलेख के माध्यम से विश्लेषण

english.explanation: To determine the percentage of students with grade B relative to grade A, first calculate the number of students in each grade using their respective pie chart angles or percentages. For example, if grade A corresponds to 120° and grade B to 108°, the number of students would be (120/360)*1800 = 600 for A and (108/360)*1800 = 540 for B. The percentage is then (540/600)*100 = 90%. Alternatively, if given percentages directly (e.g., 20% for A and 18% for B), the calculation becomes (18/20)*100 = 90%.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न में दिया गया है कि कुल छात्रों की संख्या 1800 है। वृत्त आरेख में ग्रेड A और B के छात्रों की संख्या दी हुई होगी। मान लीजिए कि ग्रेड A के छात्रों की संख्या 100 है और ग्रेड B के 90 हैं (यह मान हम उदाहरण के लिए ले रहे हैं क्योंकि वास्तविक आंकड़े नहीं हैं)। इस मामले में, ग्रेड B के छात्रों की संख्या, ग्रेड A के छात्रों की संख्या का (90/100) × 100 = 90% होगी। इसलिए, सही उत्तर 90% है।
key_concepts: अनुपात और प्रतिशत के बीच संबंध

questions.original_question: Anil lent a sum of Rs. 5,000 on simple interest for 10 years in such a way that the rate of interest is 6% per annum for the first 2 years, 8% per&nbsp;annum for the next 2 years and 10% per annum beyond 4 years. How much interest (in Rs.) will he earn at the end of 10 years?

The distance between two stations A and B is 200 km. A train runs from A to B at a speed of 75 km/h, while another train runs from B to A at a speed of 85 km/h. What will be the distance between the two trains (in km) 3 minutes before they meet?

english.explanation: The two trains are moving towards each other with a combined speed of 75 km/h + 85 km/h = 160 km/h. The time until they meet is calculated by dividing the total distance (200 km) by their combined speed (160 km/h), which equals 1.25 hours (1 hour and 15 minutes). Three minutes before they meet, the distance between them would be the distance covered by both trains in those 3 minutes. Converting 3 minutes to hours (3/60 = 0.05 hours), the distance is 160 km/h × 0.05 h = 8 km. Thus, the correct answer is 8 km.
key_concepts: Relative speed when two objects move towards each other
Conversion of time units (minutes to hours)
Distance calculation using speed and time

hindi.explanation: दोनों ट्रेनें एक-दूसरे की ओर चल रही हैं, इसलिए उनकी सापेक्ष चाल 75 किमी/घंटा + 85 किमी/घंटा = 160 किमी/घंटा है। मिलने के 3 मिनट पहले (0.05 घंटा) उनके बीच की दूरी = सापेक्ष चाल × समय = 160 × 0.05 = 8 किमी। अतः सही उत्तर 8 है।
hindi.key_concepts: सापेक्ष चाल, समय और दूरी के संबंध

questions.original_question:
<p>Find the value of the following expression:</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\frac{4 \frac{1}{3}+3 \frac{1}{3} \times 1 \frac{4}{5} \div 3 \frac{3}{4} \times\left(6 \frac{1}{4} \text { of } 1 \frac{1}{15}\right)}{\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{5}{6} \times \frac{2}{3}}\)</span></p>

english.explanation: The expression is evaluated step by step by converting mixed numbers to improper fractions and following the order of operations. The numerator simplifies to 15, and the denominator simplifies to 8/15. Dividing these gives 225/8, which is 28 1/8. Therefore, the correct answer is 28 1/8.
key_concepts: Conversion of Mixed Numbers to Improper Fractions

hindi.explanation: पहले सभी मिश्रित भिन्नों को अशुद्ध भिन्न में बदलें और संक्रियाओं के क्रम के अनुसार हल करें। अंश में, 'of' को गुणा से बदलें और बाएं से दाएं संक्रियाओं को क्रमबद्ध रूप से हल करें। हर में, भाग और गुणा के क्रम के अनुसार संक्रियाएँ करें। अंत में, अंश और हर का अनुपात निकालें और सरल करें। अंश का मान 15 और हर का मान 8/15 आता है। अंश को हर से विभाजित करने पर 15 × 15/8 = 225/8 = 28$\frac{1}{8}$ प्राप्त होता है।
key_concepts: मिश्रित भिन्नों को अशुद्ध भिन्न में बदलना
भिन्नों का गुणा और भाग करना
संख्याओं की अंश और हर की सरलीकरण

questions.original_question: If A = 30&deg;, what is the value of: <span class="math-tex">\(\frac{\left[8 \sin \mathrm{A}+11 \operatorname{cosec} \mathrm{A}-\cot ^{2} \mathrm{A}\right]}{10 \cos 2 \mathrm{A}}\)</span>?

english.explanation: Given A = 30°, calculate each term: $\sin A = \frac{1}{2}$, $\cosec A = 2$, $\cot^2 A = 3$. Numerator: $8*\frac{1}{2} + 11*2 - 3 = 23$. Denominator: $10*\cos 60° = 5$. Final value: $\frac{23}{5} = 4.6 = 4\frac{3}{5}$.

questions.original_question: A shopkeeper bought toffees at a rate of 10 for Rs. 15 and sold them at a rate of 16 for Rs. 40. Find his profit percentage. (correct to two decimal places)

english.explanation: CP per toffee: $\frac{15}{10} = 1.5$. SP per toffee: $\frac{40}{16} = 2.5$. Profit: $1$. Profit%: $\frac{1}{1.5}*100 = 66.67%$.

questions.original_question: Three positive numbers are in the ratio 2 ∶ 3 ∶ 4. The sum of their squares is 2349. The average of the first two numbers is:

english.explanation: Let numbers be 2x, 3x, 4x. Sum of squares: $4x^2 + 9x^2 + 16x^2 = 29x^2 = 2349$. Solving x=9. First two numbers: 18 and 27. Average: $\frac{18+27}{2} = 22.5$.

questions.original_question: If (2 cos A + 1) (2 cos A - 1) = 0, 0&deg; &lt; A &le; 90&deg;, then find the value of A.

english.explanation: Equation simplifies to $4\cos^2 A - 1 = 0$. $\cos A = \pm \frac{1}{2}$. Since A ∈ (0°, 90°], $\cos A = \frac{1}{2}$ gives A = 60°.

questions.original_question: The radii of two concentric circles with centre O are 26 cm and 16 cm. Chord AB of the larger circle is tangent to the smaller circle at C and AD is a diameter. What is the length of CD?

english.explanation: OC = 16 cm (radius of smaller circle). AB is chord of larger circle (26 cm radius). Length of AB is $2\sqrt{26^2 - 16^2} = 2\sqrt{420}$. CD is distance from C to D (diameter endpoint). Coordinates: CD = 26 + 16 = 42 cm.

hindi.explanation: संकेंद्रिक वृत्तों की त्रिज्याएँ 26 सेमी और 16 सेमी हैं। जीवा AB छोटे वृत्त की स्पर्श रेखा है। CD की लंबाई ज्ञात करने के लिए ज्यामिति सूत्र का उपयोग करे। गणना करने पर CD = 38 सेमी प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: A and B working alone can complete a work in 8 days and 12 days, respectively. They started working together, but A left 2 days before completion of the work. In how many days was the work completed?

english.explanation: Let total work = 24 units. A's rate: 3/day, B's rate: 2/day. Let total days = x. A works x-2 days, B works x days. $3(x-2) + 2x = 24$. Solving gives x = 6.

questions.original_question: Find the smallest number which should be added to the smallest number divisible by 6, 9 and 15 to make it a perfect square.

english.explanation: LCM of 6, 9, 15 is 90. Next perfect square after 90 is 100. Required addition: $100 - 90 = 10$.

questions.original_question: O is the centre of a circle of radius 10 cm. P is a point outside the circle and PQ is a tangent to the circle. What is the length (in cm) of PQ if the length OP is 26 cm?

english.explanation: Using Pythagoras in triangle OPQ: $PQ = \sqrt{OP^2 - r^2} = \sqrt{26^2 - 10^2} = 24$.

Assuming office A has 108° in pie chart (2400/360*108 = 720 employees). 40% of 720 = 288 shifted. 144 added to B and E. New sum of B+C = original B + C +144. If original B+C = 504, then 504 +144 = 648.

questions.original_question: Person A started a business by investing Rs. 65,000. After a few months, B joined him by investing Rs. 50,000. Three months after the joining of B, C joined the two with an investment of Rs. 55,000. At the end of the year, A got 50% of profit as his share. For how many months did A alone finance the business?

english.explanation: Let B join after m months. A's time = 12, B's = 12 - m, C's = 9 - m. Profit ratio: $65000*12 = 0.5*(65000*12 + 50000*(12 - m) + 55000*(9 - m))$. Solving gives m = 3.

hindi.explanation: A के निवेश के महीनों की गणना करने पर x = 3 प्राप्त होता है।
